result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Addison Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 
Expires January 17, 2023

Defendant Allen Addison Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr appeared by video for Allen Addison Jr.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Court reviewed Defendant's correspondence regarding counsel issues. Discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Statements by Attorney Givens. Defendant withdrew his request for new counsel. Hearing proceeded. 

Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

At the Final PreTrial, Court will schedule a bail hearing to address Demand for Speedy Trial. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Allen Addison Jr not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in Court for Allen Addison Jr.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

HELD OFF THE RECORD. 
Case in Court for Status hearing. Defendant was not produced via Zoom for today's hearing. Parties selected a new date. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheudled for October 17, 2022 at 09:15 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Letter from defendant.  (Allen Addison, Jr. - #2022003981, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Allen Addison Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr appeared by video for Allen Addison Jr.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Givens was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Defense requested additional time to investigate matter. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Status hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Glenn Givens

Defendant Allen Addison in court, in custody. Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing. Discussion placed on the record. SPD has not appointed counsel. Statements made by Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Order to Show Cause hearing. Clerk provided information to the Public Defenders Office. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Order to show cause scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Allen Addison in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for an Final PreTrial hearing. Defendant appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense unable to proceed to Jury Trial. Defense advised the court of Motion to Withdraw as Counsel due to a breakdown in communication with Defendant. State had no position on the matter. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Court will allow Attorney Batt to Withdraw as counsel and ordered Jury Trial date VACATED. Court TOLLED TIME LIMITS. Statements by Defendant regarding medical condition and lack of treatment received at CJF.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
WRONG CASE. Document moved to the correct Defendant's case.

Defendant Allen Addison in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense has not received complete Discovery materials and requested an adjournment. State confirmed. State entered Plea offer on the record. Court granted request. Case adjourned for Jury Status hearing and Speedy Jury Trial, Branch 46. 

Jury Status hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 2:45 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. Speedy Jury Trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.

Defense received partial discovery material. Defense has NOT received an offer. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:25 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Allen Addison in Court with Attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr on behalf of Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Scheduling Conference proceeded.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Allen Addison in court with Attorney Douglas E. Batt; both appear by video.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 14CF264. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: J. Majerle - MPD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Allen Addison, Jr. - #202200398, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Allen Addison, Jr. - #2022003981, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Allen Addison not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE RECALLED:
Defendant Allen Addison not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
States witness is now present. Witness would like an afternoon for the next date. Time is changed from 8:30am to 1:30pm. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Allen Addison not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring for No Contact Order Monitoring and drug testing.
Signed and filed, No Contact/Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E.J.K.

Defendant Allen Addison in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Allen Addison appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
